image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives About this object

profileText: A Representative from Hawaii; born in Honolulu, Honolulu County, Hawaii, July 1, 1967; graduated from Pearl City High School, Pearl City, Hawaii, 1985; B.A., University of Hawaii, Manoa , Hawaii, 1990; M.P.H., University of Hawaii, Manoa, Hawaii, 1993; Hawaii Army National Guard, 1999-2016; member of the Hawaii state house of representatives, 1994-2014, vice speaker, 2005-2006; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Fourteenth Congress; served until his death on July 20, 2016 (January 3, 2015-July 20, 2016); died on July 20, 2016, in Honolulu, Hawaii; interment at National Memorial Cemetery of the Pacific, Honolulu, Hawaii.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Mark Takai" in Asian and Pacific Islander Americans in Congress, 1900-2017. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of the Historian and the Office of the Clerk, U.S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Publishing Office, 2018.

researchRecord.description: The papers of Congressman Mark Takai have not yet been processed.

parentRecordLocation.name: University of Hawaii at Manoa Library
